purpose: Define the operational limits and permissions that each engine must follow to maintain system stability and safety.

generalRules.noSelfModification: Engines must not modify their own code or configuration files.
generalRules.readOnlyManifests: Engine access to manifests must be read only.
generalRules.noDirectSystemWrite: Engines may not write to system folders except through authorised channels.
generalRules.runtimeIsolation: Each engine must run in its own execution boundary.
generalRules.boundedExecution: Engines must complete operations within defined time and resource limits.

resourceLimits.cpuLimit: Maximum 25 percent utilisation per engine instance.

integrationRules.telemetryDependency: Engines must read validated telemetry before acting.
integrationRules.sealRequirement: Engines may only activate if all seals are valid.
integrationRules.manifestRequirement: Engines may only load if the corresponding manifest is verified.
integrationRules.governanceAlignment: Engines must follow governance outcomes without override.

failureActions.ruleBreach: Stop the engine and write an audit entry.
failureActions.repeatedBreaches: Switch system to controlled mode and escalate to CoreController.
failureActions.criticalBreach: Stop all engines and enter critical mode.

summary.statement: These boundary rules create a predictable and safe execution environment for all WyneOS engines. No engine may operate outside these limits.
